key_points: Online claims suggested Kyle Rittenhouse had a 'two-week, all-expenses-paid vacation' at Mar-a-Lago after his acquittal.
Rittenhouse was acquitted of charges for killing two people and injuring another during a 2020 protest in Kenosha, Wisconsin.
The misinformation spread rapidly on social media, accumulating thousands of shares.
Rittenhouse did visit Florida and Mar-a-Lago the weekend after his trial for an interview and met former President Donald Trump.
Trump confirmed he met Rittenhouse and his mother at Mar-a-Lago, stating Rittenhouse was a fan and wanted to say hello.
Trump's spokesperson tweeted a photo of Rittenhouse and Trump at Mar-a-Lago.
Rittenhouse's lawyer stated the claim of a two-week vacation is incorrect, but did not specify the length of Rittenhouse's stay.
Trump mentioned in an interview that Rittenhouse had left Mar-a-Lago a few days after the verdict.
The claim of a two-week, all-expenses-paid vacation at Mar-a-Lago for Rittenhouse is rated as false.
Kyle Rittenhouse was only at Mar-a-Lago for days at most, not for a two-week vacation.
